formalText: Elizabeth, by every everyone calls her Liz.
She's having trouble with fear of germs and fear of intruders coming to attack her family.
She feels that if she doesn't do certain things each day, that bad things will happen.
Yes, she would like to get my help, because she can't seem to get through the day without these rituals taking so much time out of her life.
They are getting worse.
Yes, she feels the need to wash her hands constantly.
She is afraid of getting germs from things that other people touch.
She feels she needs to wash them three times.
Every time she touches something that someone else may have touched such as door knob light switch for a faucet handle.
She usually uses a paper towel to open things.
So she doesn't have to touch anything directly if she touches something, and she doesn't wash three times.
Then she is afraid that she will get get germs that could cause her to get sick.
She has fears that she forgets to lock the door turn off the lights.
So she will go and turn the Lock 3 times in the need to wash her hands three times.
She finds this happening so much that she is late for her job in the morning, on her way to work.
She has had to turn around and drive home to see if she remembered to turn off the coffee pot.
This is embarrassing because she knows what she is doing.
She can't stop it.
She's afraid that she will get some bad germs that will get into her body.
And if she doesn't lock the lock the door, then someone will come and attack her and her family if she doesn't check the doors in the windows and lock everything three times.
She just feels that something bad will happen.
Then she's afraid that she forgot to lock the doors in the windows.
So she's repeatedly checking on them.
She must wash her hands three times because of germs.
She washes her hands probably 60 times a day.
She has contact dermatitis on her hands because they are irritated from the constant washing.
She finds that she needs to change her clothes more than once a day.
Yes, she changed after she comes in from work or being out in public.
She has separate laundry hampers for her clothes depending on where she wore them. Work is different than the grocery store.
She checks everything before she leaves work, when she comes home from work, and before bed, and waking up in the morning. If she's checked three times, then it feels right.
She feels relief if she checks in town three times.
She feels that she must do everything three times. The washing, counting, and checking takes up so much time, and she knows it is not normal.
She wants to stop. She wants to feel normal again.
She has always been particular about things but this is really taking over her life.
She wants to stop, but if she doesn't do the county, checking, and washing, then it doesn't feel right.
She feels relief when she gets these things.
It's only temporary belief, but really really spot relief nonetheless.

She would be willing to try medication cognitive behavioral therapy and exposure and response prevention therapy to begin changing these behaviors.
She takes a multivitamin, and Tylenol or Advil for headaches, which isn't often.
She's 36, and she was about 12 or 13 one of these things started for sure.

She has always been a clean and neat person from childhood.

It's terrible.

Her siblings are both living and healthy.
